snippet: As Mrs. Clinton approaches her 2016 presidential campaign, she and her advisers are trying to determine the risks of aligning too closely with President Obama, and of keeping him at a distance.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton and her team have been grappling with question of how close to align themselves with Pres Obama as she makes case to voters that she should be next president; advisers say closely allying her campaign to Obama's record will result in benefits that outweigh risks of Republicans attacking her presidency as third Obama term.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK, MAGGIE HABERMAN and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: As Mrs. Clinton approaches her 2016 presidential campaign, she and her advisers are trying to determine the risks of aligning too closely with President Obama, and of keeping him at a distance.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Weighs How to Recast Ties to Obama
headline.print_headline: Clinton Weighs How to Recast Ties to Obama
